ayas.translation: WHEN WHAT IS to happen comes to pass --

bismillah.translation: In the name of Allah, most benevolent, ever-merciful.

ayas.translation: Which is bound to happen undoubtedly --
Degrading (some) and exalting (others);
When the earth is shaken up convulsively,
The mountains bruised and crushed,
Turned to dust, floating in the air,
You will become three categories:
Those of the right hand -- how (happy) will be those of the right hand!
Then those of the left hand -- how (unhappy) will be those of the left hand!
Then the foremost, how pre-excellent,
Who will be honoured
In gardens of tranquility;
A number of the earlier peoples,
And a few of later ages,
On couches wrought of gold,
Reclining face to face.
Youths of never-ending bloom will pass round to them
Cups and decanters, beakers full of sparkling wine,
Unheady, uninebriating;
And such fruits as they fancy,
Bird meats that they relish,
And companions with big beautiful eyes
Like pearls within their shells,
As recompense for all they had done.

ayas.arabic: لَا يَسْمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغْوًا وَلَا تَأْثِيمًا
ayas.translation: They will hear no nonsense there or talk of sin,
ayas.transliteration: lā yasma`ūna fīhā laghwan walā ta-thīmā

ayas.translation: Other than "Peace, peace" the salutation.
As for those of the right hand -- how (happy) those of the right hand --
They will be in (the shade) of thornless lote
And acacia covered with heaps of bloom,
Lengthened shadows,
Gushing water,
And fruits numberless,
Unending, unforbidden,
And maidens incomparable.
We have formed them in a distinctive fashion,
And made them virginal,
Loving companions matched in age,
For those of the right hand.
A crowd of earlier generations
And a crowd of the later.
But those of the left hand -- how (unhappy) those of the left hand --
Will be in the scorching wind and boiling water,
Under the shadow of thick black smoke
Neither cool nor agreeable.
They were endowed with good things
But persisted in that greater sin,

ayas.arabic: وَكَانُوا۟ يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتْنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابًا وَعِظَـٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبْعُوثُونَ
ayas.translation: And said: "What! When we are dead and turned to dust and bones, shall we then be raised again?
ayas.transliteration: wakānū yaqūlūna a-idhā mitnā wakunnā turāban wa`iẓāman a-innā lamab`ūthūn

ayas.translation: And so will our fathers?"
Say: "Indeed, the earlier and the later generations
Will be gathered together on a certain day which is predetermined.
Then you, the erring and the deniers,
Will eat of the tree of Zaqqum,
Fill your bellies with it,
And drink over it scalding water,
Lapping it up like female camels raging of thirst with disease."
Such will be their welcome on the Day of Judgement.
It is He who created you, then why do you not affirm the truth?
Just consider (the semen) that you emit,
Do you create it, or We are its creator?

ayas.arabic: نَحْنُ قَدَّرْنَا بَيْنَكُمُ ٱلْمَوْتَ وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمَسْبُوقِينَ
ayas.translation: We have incorporated death in your constitution, and We shall not be hindered
ayas.transliteration: naḥnu qaddarnā baynakumul mawta wa mā naḥnu bimasbūqīn

ayas.arabic: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ أَمْثَـٰلَكُمْ وَنُنشِئَكُمْ فِى مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: From replacing you with others or raising you in a way you do not know.
ayas.transliteration: `alā an nubaddila amthālakum wanunshi-akum fī mā lā ta`lamūn

ayas.arabic: وَلَقَدْ عَلِمْتُمُ ٱلنَّشْأَةَ ٱلْأُولَىٰ فَلَوْلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
ayas.translation: You have known the first creation, then why do you not reflect?
Just ponder over what you sow:
Do you give it its increase, or are We the giver?

ayas.arabic: لَوْ نَشَآءُ لَجَعَلْنَـٰهُ حُطَـٰمًا فَظَلْتُمْ تَفَكَّهُونَ
ayas.translation: We could turn it, if We pleased, into straw; then you would rue the day,
ayas.transliteration: law nashā-u laja`alnāhu ḥuṭāman faẓaltum tafakkahūn

ayas.translation: (And say:) "We have fallen into debt;
Indeed, we have been deprived of the fruits of our labour."
Consider the water that you drink.

ayas.arabic: ءَأَنتُمْ أَنزَلْتُمُوهُ مِنَ ٱلْمُزْنِ أَمْ نَحْنُ ٱلْمُنزِلُونَ
ayas.translation: Do you send it down from the clouds, or We send it down?
ayas.transliteration: a-antum anzaltumūhu minal muzni am naḥnul munzilūn

ayas.arabic: لَوْ نَشَآءُ جَعَلْنَـٰهُ أُجَاجًا فَلَوْلَا تَشْكُرُونَ
ayas.translation: We could make it brackish, if We pleased; so why do you not acknowledge thanks?
ayas.transliteration: law nashā-u ja`alnāhu ujājan falawlā tashkurūn

ayas.translation: Consider the fire that you strike (and get by friction).

ayas.arabic: ءَأَنتُمْ أَنشَأْتُمْ شَجَرَتَهَآ أَمْ نَحْنُ ٱلْمُنشِـُٔونَ
ayas.translation: Have you raised its tree, or We have raised it?
ayas.transliteration: a-antum ansha-tum shajaratahā am naḥnul munshi-ūn

ayas.translation: We have made it as a reminder and convenience for the needy.
ayas.transliteration: naḥnu ja`alnāhā tadhkiratan wa matā`al lil-muqwyn

ayas.translation: So glorify your Lord, the most supreme.
So I call the placement of the stars to witness --
And this surely is great evidence if you can understand --
That this is indeed the glorious Qur'an
(Inscribed) in the well-kept Book.
Only they can reach it who are clean (of mind).
It has been revealed by the Lord of all the worlds.
Then why do you dissimulate this Revelation?
You live by calling it a lie.
Then how is it that when the (dying) breath is withdrawn into the throat (and rattles),
And you wait for the moment (of death),

ayas.arabic: وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنكُمْ وَلَـٰكِن لَّا تُبْصِرُونَ
ayas.translation: We are closer to him than you, even though you cannot see?
ayas.transliteration: wanaḥnu aqrabu ilayhi minkum walākin lā tubṣirūn

ayas.translation: Then why, if you are not indebted (to Us for life),
Can you not bring him back? (Answer) if you are truthful
Then, if he is one of the honoured,
There will be peace and plenty, and gardens of tranquility for him.

ayas.arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنْ أَصْحَـٰبِ ٱلْيَمِينِ
ayas.translation: If he is of those of the right hand,
ayas.transliteration: wa-ammā in kāna min aṣ-ḥābil yamīn

ayas.translation: There will be the salutation by those of the right hand: "Peace on you.

ayas.arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْمُكَذِّبِينَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
ayas.translation: But if he is of the deniers and the errants,
ayas.transliteration: wa-ammā in kāna minal mukadhhibīnaḍ ḍāllīn

ayas.translation: The welcome will be boiling water
And the roasting in Hell.
This is indeed the ultimate truth.
Then praise your Lord, the most supreme.
